simts
  • From Models

Correlation Analysis Functions

Correlation Analysis function computes and plots both empirical ACF and PACF or both univariate and multivariate cases.

corr_analysis(x, lagmax = 0, cor = TRUE, demean = TRUE, show.ci = TRUE,
  alpha = 0.05, plot = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

x

An "ts" object.
lagmax

A integer indicating the max lag.
cor

A bool indicating whether the correlation (TRUE) or covariance (FALSE) should be computed.
demean

A bool indicating whether the data should be detrended (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
show.ci

A bool indicating whether to show confidence region.
alpha

A double indicating the confidence interval level. Default is 0.05.
plot

A bool indicating whether to plot.
...

Additional parameters.

Value

Two array of dimensions \(N \times S \times S\).

Examples

# Plot the Partial Autocorrelation
corr_analysis(datasets::AirPassengers)
#> $ACF
#> , , x
#> 
#>          ACF
#> 0  1.0000000
#> 1  0.9480473
